sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A paraphrase upon Rev. I. The plain meaning of the first chapter of the Revelation, set forth in way of paraphrase, and notes. Being also an exhortaion , not to rest in the literal sense of the epistles; but to seek out for such a one, as may be answerable to the stateliness of their common frontispeice, I know thy works. Garrett, Walter.
8p.
printed June, 1669. And are to be had at Mr. Ball's in Lee-street hard by Red-Lion-Square, [London : 1699]
Caption title. Imprint from colphon. By Walter Garrett. At upper right corner of title page: Numb. 2. Reproduction of the original at the Christ Church Library, Oxford.
=======

printed June, 1669. And are to be had at Mr. Ball's in Lee-street hard by Red-Lion-Square, [London : 1699]
